intro: Baphia eriocalyx, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae) and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces elongated pods that contain flattened, winged seeds. It is valued for its durable wood, which is used in furniture and construction. Baphia eriocalyx thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests.
